newsitem.title: UK: London tea auction finds good demand.
newsitem.headline: London tea auction finds good demand.

text.p: Demand was good at Monday's tea auction in London where the best price realized was 166 pence for a Kenya PF.1 and Rwanda PD.

Strong and general demand continued for landed teas. Bright liquoring and good medium East Africans often advanced 2 to 5 pence with coloury mediums fully firm to dearer. The few Ceylons were also dearer.
Among offshores, good demand was seen for brighter teas at fully firm rates but plainer sorts eased.
The next auction is on Apil 28.
